page.title: 11A Ringmer Blacksmith's Day
page.content: A{Blacksmith's day}starts at around eight o'clock. The first job he does is to light the coals of the{forge.} Then he stokes the forge to get the coals glowing red. The{horses}then arrive to be{shod.}He has to trim the{ {hoof}before fitting a new shoe. He has already got horseshoes made but he may have to re-adjust them to fit. Sometimes he has to make a complete new shoe from a straight concave bar. It takes around{1.5 hours}to shoe a horse. Sometimes he travels to the horse with his{mobile forge.}If he has no horses to be shod he will do any{ welding jobs, make wrought iron gates} or sharpen any tools, put handles on spades, put iron tyres on wooden cart wheels. His day finishes at around five o'clock
